author: {'steamid': '76561198309013410', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1683888046}
review: This game is simple, yet pretty addicting. My first run lasted me an hour, and it felt pretty good learning what to do. It does feel a little unfair at times, but usually if you take damage, you only have yourself to blame. My only complaint is that there isn't much to do when you learn the ropes, you walk around shooting enemies, maybe pick up a one use scroll, and that's pretty much it. There are 3 weapons for each character, and the weapons function similarly to Mario powerups; you start out with a peashooter, upgrade to something better, then get something really good. If you die, you go back to the first weapon. It's a pretty unique weapon system for a roguelike, but it really does leave a lot to be desired. The game is fun for a run or two, but you can only get so much of the gameplay before you start getting exhausted. It's definitely worth an hour or two of your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1652020530}
review:
"Attack of the Labyrinth +" is a badly made 2D top down retro pixel twin stick shooter (yes, another one) that's thematically a weak ripoff of Gauntlet, but with shallower gameplay and lower production values.  The big selling point is local co-op, which PC gamers don't care about because we use PCs and have internet access.  Smart move, game designers, making games for nobody.

In a refreshing change of pace from most retro pixel crapware polluting Steam, you can change the controls here. That's not enough to save this dumpster fire.  Resolution can be changed too... not.  You get the option, but all that does is change the filter/scaling, it doesn't actually change the resolution.  You still get the same ugly, lumpy pixels.  A choice was made to use obsolete retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.  These flaws push this game far below minimum acceptable standards for PC. 

While this is currently "free", that's simply not true.  This was a paid product but the developers abandoned that when they discovered nobody would bother paying for a crap Gauntlet ripoff when they could play the original, better game for free in a web browser.  So they opted for a different funding tactic:  The game features a heinous and unacceptable EULA that demands the developers can spy on you, collect your data and sell/use it as they wish (possibly in violation of international laws such as GDPR).  This is just another reason to warn gamers away from this mess.  Remember, if the product is free, YOU are the product.  Stay safe out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300814983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1567158294}
review:
评分4/10
单人游戏非常无聊，也许多人同屏会比较有乐趣吧
一共四种角色，攻击方式不同，没有全试，建议攻速高的那个，丢火球速度快距离远，可以隔着一个屏幕射击敌人，不建议选攻击力高的，攻击距离太近，多的那点伤害还不够被怪砍的。
游戏最多可以四人同屏游戏，应该没有根据人数变化怪物强度的设置，感觉3人以上会比较有乐趣，因为除了玩家互动配合外，想不出来还有什么乐趣可言。

游戏缺点
一、小怪太厉害，各种远程攻击，子弹速度贼快，还多。离远了还能来得及躲，离得近根本躲不开，而且发射子弹和怪物的朝向完全无关，属于和你90度站位，子弹都能飞向你的那种，根本没法预估走位，只能不停移动。
二、怪物刷新频率太高，你只能勇往直前，因为刚到下一屏，上一屏的怪又刷新了，往前走和往后退都是怪，如果你想放风筝，会发现腹背受敌，非常难受。结合第一条的小怪各种远程攻击，简直吐血
三、攻击方式太单一了，没有任何技能，平A到底。结合第二条，这个平A基本不用停，得一直点着鼠标。无脑平A，打到睡着
四、毫无剧情。上来就让你跟着指引走，下去就开砍，一路上没个剧情对话，就一层一层往下砍，杀了怪就掉金币，金币也就买血和命，太无聊了

author: {'steamid': '76561198152149518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1550985218}
review:
I've had this game for years and I will say, it is a fantastic party game.  It moves quickly, the controls are solid, and visuals are a blast.  Any issues are also quickly resolved and the dev has been pretty great about responding.  

If you have some friends, pick it up.  It's free, it's great.  What the hell are you waiting for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6897, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1632250807}
review:
KILL MONSTERS. DESTROY EVIL. GET RICH.

The forces of evil have invaded the land. A labyrinth of evil has appeared in the kingdom and legions of monsters are pouring out of its vile depths. The king has called upon a small party of heroes, the Champions of Virtue, to vanquish the demon within and free the land from a grim fate!
An action arcade game for 1-4 players. With the help of ancient magics and piles of gold, you must find the hidden relic in each area to reach the heart! Who can vanquish the evil within the Labyrinth, and who can escape with the most riches?

GOT WHAT IT TAKES TO BE A CHAMPION?

- Arcade shoot-em up action
- Up to 4 players locally
- play as a Knight, Wizard, Archer or Dragon!
- dungeons are randomly generated
- battle through 10 levels of the labyrinth to reach the heart of evil!
- collect upgrades to help you mow down the forces of darkness!
- Find powerful scrolls to aid your quest

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1529766287}
review:
Tags: Topdown Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Swarmed by ranged enemies that shoot out of screen. Constant enemy respawn. No XP for the grind. Mazes, keyhunt and door finding as main goals.

As a free game that features local co-op this is alright. But I do not know that I would want to drag someone I know in to play this with me. It is a tad too simplistic and frustrating of an experience and gets old fairly quickly. 

Normally I would not go out of my way to review a free to play product negatively but since I have this product locked in my library through bundle purchases I find myself having to.

The pixelart was kinda cute-ish but there is not a ton of variety in the assets so it gets samey quickly.

I would prefer to play Binding of Isaac or Enter the Gungeon rather tha play this. Removing local content permanently and hiding from library for declutter so better games can have better visibility in my collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975183383', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1514413056}
review:
Attack of the Labyrinth + (AotL) es un jueguecito pequeño y modesto, que trata de ser una especie de Gauntlet mezclado con roguelike. El resultado es un juego bastante estresante donde los enemigos nunca se acaban, cada vez son mas fuertes, y tan solo recorres pasillos apuntando a todas partes con el boton de disparo pulsado intentando que no te maten, porque todos los progresos que hayas conseguido para tu personaje se reduciran a cero.

AotL es un juego bastante injusto con el jugador. Quizas es la medida que han implantado para que no sea tan corto, porque el juego apenas dura un rato si no fuera por sus laberinticos niveles donde es dificil orientarse y en los cuales solo hay centenares de enemigos persiguendote y disparandote sin ton ni son, hasta un punto que a veces no sabes ni donde esta tu personaje.

Cuando lo compré valía pocos centimos, ahora es free to play, por lo que podeis probarlo sin perder nada salvo vuestro tiempo, aunque yo no os lo recomiendo ya que hay juegos muchísimos mejores del mismo género y estilo.

Lo mejor del juego es su apartado sonoro, con musicas bastante buenas. El resto es todo muy plano, aburrido e injusto.

Valoración: 2 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031149508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1104, 'last_played': 1513131459}
review:
Times like this I wish there was a "neutral" option other than yes/no.

As a fan of twin stick shooters, and old-school arcade games, this was right up my alley.  After spending far too much time trying to reach the ending, the time has come to give up and write my 2 cents:

Like Gauntlet?  This is similar in some ways, though it does make for a better single-player experience.  You start out weak, and there are 2 levels of power up to help you along, along with scrolls that offer 1-use boost (destroy everything on-screen, make you invincible for a short period, etc).  Things start out promising for the first few levels, but around level 6 or so it becomes quite unbalanced and very grindy.  By the end, although I wanted to finish it, I had to eventually give up having reached the end-boss once only.  Maybe I'm playing it wrong.

The good:
- nice graphics
- good controls
- fun to figure out the map and hunt for your upgrades to help you along
- Not very long (at least to get to the late levels), so well suited to short game-play sessions
- Having end bosses is nice and adds to the sense of progression
- There are secrets to discover

The not-so-good:
- feels like your weapon could use a couple more levels of power up. Enemies become overwhelming in both speed and numbers in later levels, to the point where you basically have to keep restarting if you don't luck out and get a couple power-ups early. 
- The randomly placed scrolls need to be "discovered" before they start to appear. Took me awhile to figure out "discover" means actually used. So if you are hanging onto a scroll (you can only carry one), and discover a new one but don't want to waste what you have, it basically is considered "not discovered".  To compound this, it can be sometimes hard to tell the colours apart so you end up wasting one only to discover your new scroll is something you've seen before.
- Hard to be certain, but it seems like the enemies become more difficult and faster as you acquire power ups like increased shot speed.  Basically you can never really even the odds.
- Some of the bosses are pretty cheap.
- Objects are random, and some things you destroy actually spawn enemies. Since you lose your powerups when you die, it makes restarting a bit of a crap-shoot.

A key thing in Gauntlet was the generators. If you could destroy one, you basically stopped enemies from spawning. There is no such machanic here, so basically there is nothing you can do to stop things from getting hard...nothing to really even the odds at all. Things just keep coming and coming until you are over-run.

In short, it is fun while it lasts, but unless your OCD kicks in like mine did it really runs its course pretty quickly.  The game is free now, so one can't complain too much but there are definitely more balanced games out there to spend your time on.  In the end, not a terrible game but one that I wanted to like more than I actually did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054008254', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 1458, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1509798565}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329795660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1485845734}
review: The dev himself is not of fan of his own game lol.. not sure why, as it's great! Really fun game with a genre somewhere between Gauntlet and Binding of Isaac. Don't let the co-op option put you off - it's good fun in single player as well. I think the addition of right-stick fire control in the '+' version is an important one, as I would not like to play without it. Perhaps there could be more content in general to further extend replayability.. but it is well worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055977195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1483952206}
review:
Attack of the Labyrinth 
My Thoughts: Attack of the Labyrinth is not a bad game but it is also not a perfect game. There are many flaws that even the maker has ammited to and says it would take an entire rewrite of the game to create the game he imagined. That said this game is fun. With a multi player and many classes it can bring hours of entertainment either alone or with friends. I tried out all of the classes, with the melee class being nearly impossible to play, and they are all uniquely fun.
Pantsu's Rating (out of 5)
Graphics: 3 The NES style graphics leave much to the imagination, and with lighting effects somtimes you can't tell what color some of the monsters are. (White bat looks red next to torches)
Playability: 3 The controls are pretty simple, either mouse and keyboard or handheld controler, but it lacks a few options I would like to see such as the ability to put down a scroll instead of using it.
Fun: 3.5 Random generation is always great but some classes have hard times with corners or ranged enemies.
Sound: 3 The music isn't horrifing, and neither the sound affects but I wouldn't seek out a soundtrack.
Replay: 4 Random generation, multiple classes, and progressive achivements will keep you coming back for more abuse.
Final Score: 3.5 
Final Thought: This game is worth getting, and at $1.99 you wouldn't break the bank if you didn't want to wait for a sale.
Hey I figured out how to record my gameplay. Voice and my webcam is next, baby steps. I'm going to try to upload here but I think I might need a Youtube account and then link my upload from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1482505888}
review:
Heal Scroll - The Game

Keeps spawning more and more monsters with increasingly higher projectile speed so that you can't avoid enemies because of having low firepower. Treasure chests only seem to drop healing scrolls and money, while upgrades have no description on them (at least on the class that i'm playing), barely feeling like an upgrade at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1502785009}
review:
A fun little fantasy twin-stick shooter. So far as I can tell, the classes aren't well balanced - range doesn't seem to be a major factor in the balance of attacks. As such, it's hard to beat the (free) unlimited range of the mage. You can kill things you can't even see, and with a high rate of fire, that really helps keep the screen clear in the direction you are moving.

The other classes seem to pale in comparison, but it is still a fun time.

The upgrades feel like a proper shmup, they are significant, but you lose them when you die. But the permanent upgrades give the game a slight RPG feel that is cool.

The game could use a couple of things that I think would have made it more fun:

1. A more gradual ramp-up of enemy difficulty and frequency. Basically you are getting random encounters with tons of monsters right out of the gate, and there doesn't seem to be anything stopping you from bumping into rather "nasty" monsters in the very first parts of the very first level.

This isn't a flaw, by itself, but it seems like a missed opportunity to feel like you are gradually ramping up, which is common in shmups.

2. The game could use some "sanctuaries". The shops seems like the obvious choice, but it would be nice to have somewhere to go to think, count, and just look at your map for a few seconds.

These flaws are all minor, though, and the game achieves its goal very well, overall, I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970292901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1671404425}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1190, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1493616941}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976258506', 'num_games_owned': 1659, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1478372255}
review:
Overall, I've enjoyed this game. I don't exactly remember when/how I got it, but I wanted to play a dungeon crawler, popped this one in, and was surprised by it. 

From what I've collected, this game seems to have had a rocky history/start, but I can't really find anything major to gripe about it. I'd imagine major issues have since been patched by the time I played this game.

Attack of the Labyrinth is pretty basic and it can be beaten in about 80 minutes if you're experienced with the genre, slightly longer if not. It's hard to get a game over in this game because if you're decent at it and like to explore you'll either find a ton of 1UP's or be able to buy lots of them from the store. There are two endings that I'm aware of and the requirements to get the "good" ending aren't that hard.

My only real gripe is that there's something weird going on with the achievements, namely that some people think one of them is outright broken, and that there are a couple whose unlock requirements are unclear. As I write this review there's no guide and no insight on the forum as to what's what. If you're looking for completion, I'd stay away from this one.

The game is a "solid 5" on a 1-10 scale, to me at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976235978', 'num_games_owned': 1923, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1455649383}
review:
This game is ok and clean (no bugs as far as i know, graphics and music are ok), this doesn't look like some crappy game made in 24 hours. So that's a positive point :D

Gameplay is ok too, but quickly boring as you keep shooting and shooting against endless waves of foes.
Only problem that i have is the fact that there is almost no replay value, unless you're curious about the story. Every time you die, you're good to start over from scratch, and i really don't like that in a rogue like game.

So all in all, this game is cool, and will be probably even cooler with friends to play with. Even if it's not the game of the year, it is totally worth its very low price, and might and the studio making new games ;) So if you have a couple dollars to donate, that might be a good idea to put them here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970541793', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1453067119}
review:
Ya know, for what it is.. it isn't bad as a generic dungeon crawl. It isn't amazing and no real replayability factor, but it was cheap, it handled local co-oip and you can beat it in a sitting. 

A solic cheapie game. Short moderate fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014665763', 'num_games_owned': 1991, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1450729164}
review:
The most accurate word to describe this game would be 'basic'. The visuals are basic, the mechanics are basic and the content is basic. It seems fun at first but by the end of the first couple of short levels you will have seen pretty much everything the game has to offer. It's really just a mindless grind through endlessly respawning enemies.

The are many dungeon crawlers on Steam and almost all of them are better than this one. My advice would be to buy Hammerwatch instead; it's a far superior game in every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028018534', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1449061561}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WbB4NGIG068

Attack of the Labyrinth is fun little arcade game. Sadly, it doesn't offer much depth, but it isn't an expensive title. This is first impressions of the game.

A peaceful kingdom is treathen by dark presence. A labyrinth of pure evil, with an army unlike any seen before. So, now it's up to four Champions to save the kingdom. Simple story.

This is 2D game, so the lacking of video options is understandable. So is the rebindable keys to ceratin degree. It would be nice to change them. The graphics are retro pixel art with a lot of colours

There is four classes to choose from. Those are the Champions. I only play with the Wizard. With him the gameplay is a twin-stick shooter. You have only one attack – a projectile and that's it. Well, there is more, but not much. In the levels you can find or buy upgrades. They change your projectile and your appearance. The wizard can be upgraded two times, I don't know about the others. The only other thing that can help you are scrolls. They are one time use magic spell. Health, Mace, Summon, Shield and Radiant. The last is extremely powerful clearing spell. You can carry one at a time. There is nothing more to the gameplay.

With the gold you collect from dead enemies, chests and everything that explodes, you can buy from a shop inside the level lives (yes, there are lives here), scrolls, health and upgrades and nothing more.

Dungeons or labyrinths are pretty diverce as layout. I saw ice cave, mines with tracks, grass, dirt or gold and so on. All levels are randomly generated, which add to the replayability. When you enter a labyrinth you have to find a key, then the exit. Also there is place with a map, that shows where those things are and the shop. There is no mini map and sometimes it's a little bit confusing. Before every boss you have to make it through series of levels. The first is small, but they get progressively larger. The labyrinth with the boss encounter are pretty big and without a mini map it can take you a while to find the key and the exit.

Enemies are okay. Different types of spiders, ghosts, archers, knights and so on. When they surround they are dangerous. The game is pretty intense and I like that. The bosses are creative and fun to fight.

Effects resemble 8-bit games from the past and they are nice. Music is okay, but not very memorable. I can't think of a single track.

The games is okay. It's very colorful with responsive controls and it's fun for a while. There is local co-op, but didn't try it. Probably it will be more fun with a friend, but I think it's a mistake not to have online multiplayer. Sadly, my biggest disappointment is the lack of gameplay depth. One projectile and scrolls. I played almost two hours and i'm already getting bored. It's just functional, fun little game. But when you consider the prise, I think the game is alright. Get the game on sale and find a friend to play with you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138206475', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1468699891}
review: słabe. błądzenie po labiryntach. na grafiku zaoszczędzono. tylko dla wytrwałych fanów tego typu produkcji

author: {'steamid': '76561197969307618', 'num_games_owned': 3012, 'num_reviews': 681, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1465170460}
review: Very lovely and engaging but very easy to pick up and play game. You run around randomly generated levels to first find a key and then exit the current floor with it in another location. You get a few classes to play, I took the knight. COmbat was very simple, just hold the left mouse button to spam a wild swing. It all boils down to rush levels and crush everything to keep your health up with pickups. Get it for a low price if you enjoy a lighthearted and simple action game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028190311', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1446413448}
review:
faire du old school, ok, mais là, c'est juste trop.
gameplay chiant, les 4 boutons de la manette (SI on a une manette 4 boutons) servent à tirer dans les 4 directions principales. très perturbant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971446226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1467016584}
review:
Game had so much potential with a nice game engine but it's not my kind of game.

Control is good, like Zelda with projectiles. Graphics and sound are decent, music is a little weak. I would rather have used twin-stick control.

I wish games had a little intro screen that explained a little, like during the attract mode of classic arcade games like PacMan, Galaxian..

Because I didn't realize what kind of game it was. The point of this game is not to continue getting more powerful and enjoying the rewards, but simply to complete the game.

The challenge keeps ramping up, but the rewards do not. There are 3 levels up upgrades you can find pretty quickly and then you just play the game like that. You can't save your progress and continue later....

There are 3 parts of the game, and once you finish a part, you permently unlock the next part, it seems. So you can start a new game and start at part 2.

But I found that if you want to try to get anywhere in the game, it will be significantly easier to play it from begining to end, starting at part 1.

But the first section is where you become powerful and build up like 10 lives. The second part is where you get bored. :p But theoretically, if you keep the momentum going, you have enough lives to bully your way through the game. If you try to pick up and play from part 2 or part 3 another time, you will be at a severe disadvantage starting those challenging areas without the 3 upgrades and lots of lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052397199', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1444572093}
review:
Всего за один доллар с копейками мы получаем... шиш, и даже без масла. Механика игры примитивнее некуда. Разнообразие врагов тут только внешнее, по поведению они не отличаются. 
Даже по скидке - воздержитесь от приобретения. Серьезно, все крайне, крайне ужасно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023555368', 'num_games_owned': 3343, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1562622333}
review:
If you get this game in a bundle, or on sale for $1.50 or less, consider it worthwhile. You can easily get 3-4hrs of fun out of it, plus another 3 if you go for the secret and 100% achievement completion. There is also 2-4 player local co-op for some quick arcade style fun. 

Consider this a casual arcade game that gets you into the action quickly but doesn't require a lot of investment. The sounds are enjoyable but I found myself disabling the music within the first hour of play, it loops fairly quickly but that is common and expected in indie games.

There are two ranged and two melee characters, each with different speed/attack/defense stats based on your style of play. You can upgrade each character twice with an upgrade powerup purchased from a shop or found during gameplay. 

The maps are randomized each playthrough and there is a map stone on each level that can help you find the exit. I like the random maps because they are drawn like a classic maze, or a cornmaze, lots of winding corners and a dead end. If I pay attention it's not too hard but if I space out I find myself going in circles. 

I didn't experience any bugs or stability issues and was glad to find that all features of the game and achievements worked fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058313102', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1708879175}
review:
A refreshing blend of action and adventure with a retro look and feel,.
The aesthetics, atmosphere and music are superb and again the retro vibe is always a welcome aspect, especially if you're a bit of an 'old skool' gamer. I thoroughly enjoy this game, and especially the controls which are simple, sharp and responsive.
I would love to see an online multiplayer option, especially as the latter levels become more and more of a challenge.
But for any gamer out there who wants a fun, enjoyable adventure battler, check this out!
You couldn't really ask for more, especially at this price. It's an absolute bargain!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000805162', 'num_games_owned': 3516, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1519032894}
review:
Neat little game with some fun exploration elements. Can feel a little grindy but only if you're trying to clear out everything rather than just make the goal.

Some sneaky little secrets and things to find/unlock make it more fun and challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1428706607}
review:
[h1]This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.[/h1]

Wow, that's pretty much the one word to describe Attack of the Labyrinth, this is of the most fun games I've had the pleasure of playing in a while. The gameplay is so simple, yet so addictive. This is a hard as nails arcade action dungeon crawling game. I'd also say it has a hint of rogue-like too. 

There are plenty of classes to choose from as with most fantasy type games, my favorite here has to be the mage, his spells get so overpowered once you rank them up. I did also spend some time playing as an archer but I struggled to find my stride there. 

As you roam around the dungeon killing the endless supply of enemies, you collect their coin and can upgrade your spells and weapons, along with buying additional lives and hearts. You have hearts per life, run out of lives and you have to start all over again. Thankfully there is some sort of gated progression here, each portal has three levels to it. As long as you beat the end boss in each portal, you'll only have to repeat one level, and not the whole game again. 

I cannot wait to try out the local co-op here and can support up to four players! The controls are so responsive to your movements, it is almost perfect.  This is an absolute gem of a bargain at its current price as there is tons of gameplay and replay ability here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998893232', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1676237910}
review:
Un gioco veloce e frenetico; non richiede particolare tempo da dedicargli, ma se gli concedete qualche minuto, potrà prendervi.

Pro: 

-Il prezzo è piuttosto basso e conveniente ma, come sempre, consiglio l'acquisto di questo prodotto in offerta.
-Veloce e graficamente "retrò"
-Achievements facili
-Classi differenti che possono essere "lievemente" potenziate durante il gameplay

Contro:

-Il sistema delle monetine appare decisamente inutile, in quanto avrebbero potuto renderlo più ampiò e variegato.
-Un pò ripetitivo alla lunga.
-Manca di vere sfide


Conclusioni:

Acquistatelo (in offerta) come un prodotto senza pretese, ma capace di regalarvi, sicuramente, un pò di immediato divertimento.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997878936', 'num_games_owned': 2034, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1606328566}
review:
I'm really enjoying this game.  It's a game that I'm finding is fun both if you only have a few minutes to kill or if you have time to really try to go through to the end.  I like the visual style of the game, it's very colorful with nicely animated characters.  The controls for character movement are really precise.

I think that if you like older arcade games like the original Gauntlet then you'll have fun with this game.  As far as the price goes, for me I think it's worth the price.  It has the feel of an old school arcade game that I would have dropped more than six dollars in quarters in.

The only con for me is that I wish the controls could be remapped.  When using an xbox controller, I wish the attacks could be mapped to the second stick instead of the buttons.  Also I have an arcade controller that I think would be great for this game if I could set the controls to use it.  Keyboard/mouse are fine as is if that's what you want to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086760999', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1552182084}
review:
Gostei muito do jogo.
- Pontos altos:
Como ser bem arcade. Lembrou muito jogos de snes e fliperama que viva colocando fichas pra ver o quão longe se conseguia chegar, acredito que seja a proposta do game e faz isso com perfeição;

Os gráficos são muito agradáveis e os sprites bem desenhados;

As conquistas são bem razoáveis, nada muito impossível...só aquela das fadas, essa pelo amor....;

Local COOP
- O que pode melhorar:

Upgrades: 
Ao invés de perdemos todo os upgrades quando morremos, poderíamos apenas baixar um level de upgrade, quando estamos em uma fase bem pra frente no jogo, com muitos mobs fica muito dificil se morrermos e perdemos os upgrades. Outro ponto a quantidade de upgrades, acredito que 3 é bem pouco, ficamos overpowered muito rápido, já que podemos comprar na lojinha;

Multiplayer: Não tenho conhecimento técnico para isso mas acredito que fazer um multiplayer online deve ser complicado, mas seria muito bom se tivesse em alguma atualização.

Classes e ataques: Poderiamos ter alguma opção de ataque, por exeplo segurando ctrl ou algo assim. Um ataque secundário deixaria o jogo mais dinâmico. A classe dragon eu não entendi muito bem, não muda muito da knight, poderia ter um diferencial (no ataque secundário por exemplo).

-Resumindo

Um jogo bem divertido de ver até onde se consegue chegar, infelizmente não joguei o coop local, mas deve ser ótimo (até 4 jogadores) e não fechei ainda (com quase 2 hrs). Quem gosta do gênero e de lembrar os arcades que te faziam ficar na locadora até sua mãe ir te buscar com uma havaiana na mão vai curtir. 

-Off
 Em relação aos comentários negativos, acho que hoje em dia, não se importam muito com desenrolar todo da história, o trabalho e dedicação que é necessário para se fazer um jogo indie de qualidade e se importam apenas em ganhar "likes e favs" no youtube ou redes sociais. Sinceramente, imagino o trabalho que deu de fazer esse jogo, enviar para o greenlight, disponibilizar uma demo para browser, e ainda responder comentários e escutar opiniões, e ainda manter um preço baixo... Parabéns ao desenvolvedor! 
Claro que todos tem um opinião, e essa é a minha.
Recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067978640', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1428124053}
review:
* 5-6 hours of gameplay
* Local Co-op
* Cool pixel graphics
* Tight controls
* So much money to collect
* Achievments
* Awesome dev

You should grab it now if you like this sort of game, or just wait for the price to drop in a couple of weeks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030186387', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1427854117}
review: best game i played all day

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1502404104}
review:
従業員数一名のTimedrop Studiosが送る、ランダム生成の迷宮
全10フロアを攻略するガントレット風味な見下ろしアクションゲー

残機制でエクストラライフは店で買うこともできるが、4人までの
COOPでは個別の残機を使い果たすと壁をすり抜けられる幽霊になり
その状態でもコインを集めれば自力復活できる一風変わったつくり

もっと珍しいのはフレンドリーファイアをするためだけのキーがあり
それを押しながらであれば味方を殺せるという仲良く喧嘩しな仕様

ユーザー次第でいくらでも難易度が調整できそうなこのゲームだが
残念ながら現状ではCOOPモードはローカルのみとなっている

将来的にオンラインCOOPを実装する気はないのかと訊いてみたら
「出来るものならしたいけど、僕は本職のプログラマじゃないから
きっと時間かかるよ」とのお答えだったので今後の更新に期待したい


ちなみに最初から遠距離攻撃ができて強化後の付与属性も優秀な
アーチャーとメイジに比べて、どこまで行っても結局敵に近づいて
ブン殴る以外に手がないナイトとドラゴンのハズレっぷりがすごい

author: {'steamid': '76561198020479238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1427709812}
review:
It's just not that good...

[u][url=http://youtu.be/x3g8-X_9zSc]Watch me lose faith in the game by the minute with my Build-a-Review[/url][/u]

Pro:
_Looks good: The game looks simple, but vibrant. The character and attack animation all looks nice too. Wide variety of enemies sprites as well.
_Plays well: Controls exactly as you'd expect it. Feels precise.
_Co-op: The game has co-op, and co-op play should make almost any game better.

Cons:
_Bare-boned: This whole game feels like one level. The enemies, while varied in looks, mostly behave the same way. The levels are all the same too, with no set-pieces or events or anything interesting. The 4 chracters are basically only 2 characters: The melee type, and the ranged type. Chracters upgrade in a linear fashion twice, but there's no variety in term of how they're upgraded. There's no items that change the way you play. Shops only sell the same thing over and over. The list goes on.
_Short, really really short: I mean, it's really short. Might be a blessing, I suppose, if you're not having a good time. But it's hard to excuse a game that is THIS short, even on a $6 price tag.
_Co-op is only local: Minor point, really, but worth mentioning.
_WAY too easy, too.

Is it worth $6? I'm afraid not, and that's coming from the guy that gives every game the benefit of the doubt. It's simply too short, too shallow, too dumb, too easy, too simple. There's nothing here for you, the gamer. Game dev, if you're reading this, this is not a game, it's a level. It's a good start, but not enough is here.
